info.headline: Hard Freeze Watch issued May 18 at 9:22PM MDT until May 20 at 9:00AM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...HARD FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... ...HARD FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the first Hard Freeze Watch, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 26 possible. For the second Hard Freeze Watch, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 25 possible. * WHERE...Wasatch Back and Bear Lake and Bear River Valley. * WHEN...For the first Hard Freeze Watch, from late Thursday night through Friday morning. For the second Hard Freeze Watch, from late Friday night through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
